IN THE HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM
PRESENT
THE HONOURABLE MR. JUSTICE K.ABRAHAM MATHEW
FRIDAY, THE 04TH DAY OF JANUARY 2019 / 14TH POUSHA, 1940
Cr1.MC.No. 50 of 2019

cc 291/2018 OF J.M.F.C.-I, HOSDRUG

CRIME NO. 401/2017 OF CHANDERA POLICE STATION, KASARGOD

PETITIONER/S:
C. ASHOKAN,
AGED 43 YEARS
S/O T.V. NARAYANAN, RESIDING AT THAZHATHE
VEETTIL, EDATTUMMEL, NORTH THRIKKARIPUR
VILLAGE, HOSDURG TALUK, KASARAGOD DISTRICT-
671310.
BY ADVS.
SRI .T.MADHU
SMT .C.R.SARADAMANT

RESPONDENT/S:

1 THE STATE OF KERALA,
REPRESENTED BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, HIGH COURT
OF KERALA, ERNAKULAM-682031.
2 NITHIN V.,

AGED 23 YEARS
S/O NARAYANAN K., RESIDING AT EDATTUMMEL
HOUSE, NORTH THRIKKARIPUR VILLAGE, HOSDURG
TALUK, KASARAGOD DISTRICT-671315.
BY ADV. SANGEETHA. G

a
2019/KER/221

Crl.MC.No. 50 of 2019

1i2..

OTHER PRESENT:

SRI.C.S.HRITHWIK SR PP

THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON

04.01.2019, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE

FOLLOWING:

ORDER
Petition filed under Section 482 Cr.P.C.

2. The petitioner is the accused in CC No. 291 of
2018 on the file of the Judicial First Class
Magistrate Court-I, Hosdurg registered for the
offences under Sections 324 & 506 of the
Indian Penal Code. The second respondent is
the victim. It is submitted that the matter
has been settled and the proceedings in the
criminal case may be quashed.

3. Heard the learned counsel for the petitioner
and the second respondent and the learned
Public Prosecutor.

4. I have perused the affidavit filed by the
second respondent, who has entered appearance

cece
2019/KER/221
Crl.MC.No. 50 of 2019
1.3..
through counsel. I am satisfied that the
allegation of settlement is true and no public
interest is involved. There is no impediment
for granting the prayer of the petitioner.
In the result, this Crl.M.C. is allowed. The
proceedings in CC No. 291 of 2018 on the file
of the Judicial First Class Magistrate
Court-I, Hosdurg are quashed. The learned
magistrate may pass appropriate orders for the
disposal of the material objects, if any,
produced in the case.
Sd/-
K.ABRAHAM MATHEW
JUDGE
Bka/07.01.2019
